name: Dang Tuan Nhon
content: Tommy Dang: Homepage Tommy Dang Associate Professor Department of Computer Science Texas Tech University Phone: 806-319-3156 Email: tommy.dang [at] ttu.edu Activities Projects Teaching Publications Home ABOUT I am an associate professor and director of the interactive Data Visualization Lab (iDVL) at Texas Tech University. RESEARCH INTERESTs Developing methods and tools for visual analytics - an integrated approach combining visualization, human factors and data analysis to derive insight from massive, dynamic, and ambiguous data. EDUCATION 2010-2014: Phd in Computer Science, University of Illinois at Chicago. My PhD advisor was Prof. Leland Wilkinson 2008-2009: M.Sc. in Computer Science, University of Illinois at Chicago 2006-2008: M.Sc. in Computer Engineering, Politecnico di Milano, Italy 2001-2006: B.Sc. in Computer Science, University of Technology, Vietnam WORK EXPERIENCE 2024-Present: Associate Professor at Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas 2016-2024: Assistant Professor at Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas 2014-2016: Postdoctoral researcher at Electronic Visualization Laboratory, Chicago 2017-2018: Consultant in computational visualization for Wave Computing, Santa Clara, CA 2015-2016: Consultant in network visualization for Objectivity Inc., San Jose, CA 2014-2015: Consultant in data visualization for Skytree Inc. - The Machine Learning Company 2008-2014: Research assistant in the Computer Science Department at University of Illinois at Chicago SELECTED JOURNAL PUBLICATIONS 2016: [J5] Tuan Dang, Nick Pendar, and Angus Forbes. TimeArcs: Visualizing Fluctuations in Dynamic Networks. Computer Graphics Forum 35(3), EuroVis 2016. DOI 2014: [J4] Tuan Dang and Leland Wilkinson. Transforming Scagnostics to Reveal Hidden Features. IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics 20(12), VAST 2014. DOI 2012: [J3] Tuan Dang, Anushka Anand, and Leland Wilkinson. TimeSeer: Scagnostics for High-Dimensional Time Series. IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics 19(3), TVCG 2012. DOI 2010: [J1] Tuan Dang, Leland Wilkinson, and Anushka Anand. Stacking Graphic Elements to Avoid Over-Plotting. IEEE Transactions on Visualization AndComputer Graphics 16(6), InfoVis 2010. DOI INVITED TALKS 2021,2022,2023,2024: Introduction to Computer Science. WCOE 2022 Summer Camp. Faculty talk 2022: Data visualization and applications. Data Science Summer Workshop. Sam Houston State University , TX 2021: Multivariate time series Analysis. Distinguished Computer Science Colloquium. New Mexico Tech, NM 2020: Visual Analytics for high-dimensional and time-series. Spring 2020 NSF CAC Industry Advisory Board. Keynote Speech (Online) 2020: Multidimensional Time Series Visualization. TTU Computer Science departmental seminars. Lubbock, TX 2020: Introduction to Computer Science. WCOE 2020 Summer Camp. Faculty talk (Online) 2019: Visual analytics and Virtual Reality. The Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience area of Experimental Psychology. Lubbock, TX 2018: VR and AR in Unity. Lab Innovations with Technology. Webinar with Cal State faculty 2018: Data-center Automation, Analytics, and Control with Redfish. Dell EMC booth. Kay Bailey Convention Center Dallas, TX Giving a talk at Dell EMC booth 2018: Visualizing, Monitoring, and Automating Data Centers. Fall 2018 NSF CAC Industry Advisory Board Meeting. Denton, TX 2017: Visualizing Biological Pathways. Bio-IT World Conference & Expo. Cambridge Healthtech Institute in Boston, MA 2016: Data visualization and visual analytics. TTU Computer Science departmental seminars. Lubbock, TX 2015: Feature-based Visual Analysis. Chicago Chapter ACM. Chicago, IL 2014: Visualizing relationships in massive and dynamic data. Skytree tech talk. San Jose, CA 2013: Interactive Visual Analysis of Images. Doctoral Colloquium, IEEE VisWeek. Atlanta, GA ACTIVITIES 2024: Reviewer for one tenure and promotion dossier externally. 2023: Reviewer for DOE PAMS, U.S. DOE Phase IIB SBIR Proposal. 2022: Finance Chair of BDCAT2022, 9th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies 2022: Program Committee of EnVirVis 2022, ISVC 2022. 2021: Reviewer for DOE, The Office of Advanced Scientific Computing Research (ASCR) within the Department of Energy Office of Science. 2021: Program Committee of ACM PEARC21, EnVirVis 2021, ISVC 2021. 2020-2021: Topic editor for MDPI Sensor journal. 2020: Reviewer for NSF the CCRI Program. 2020: IPC of IMMM 2020, EnVirVis 2020 , ISVC 2020, VDS 2020, and ACM Conference on Recommender Systems 2019: Program Committee of the 13th ACM Conference on Recommender Systems, The IEEE International Workshop on Deep Analysis of Data-Driven Applications, and The 2019 International Workshop on Big Social Media Data Management and Analysis 2018: Program Committee of the 12th ACM Conference on Recommender Systems and Big Data Engineering and BigEACPS'18 2017-2018: Undergraduate Program Committee, Course Equivalent Evaluator, and Admission Committee 2016-2017: Graduate
